p: In vivo studies on G. pentaphyllum showed that its polysaccharides effectively increased the spleen and thymus indices, activated macrophage phagocytosis and NK cells, and exhibited activity on Con A/LPS-stimulated splenocytes in a dose-dependent manner. It also increased the IL-2 levels in sera and spleen, as well as the SOD, GSH-Px, T-AOC, GSH, and CAT levels; conversely, MDA levels were decreased ( 200). Aerial parts showed promising prospects as purposeful food and nutraceuticals owing to their numerous biological activities including antioxidant, immunomodulation, and antitumor ( 201). Multiple mechanisms of action have been proposed regarding the anticancer activities of plants including immunomodulating action ( 202).
